reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Organisational Support for The Family Federation of Finland

description.narrative: The Family Federation of Finland is an expert organisation focusing on sexual and reproductive health and rights and the only representative of the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) in Finland. Finland is one of UNFPA's largest and longest-standing fi nancial supporters and The Family Federation of Finland promotes the same priorities as UNFPA through its own human rights-based work that focuses on promoting the sexual and reproductive health and rights of the most vulnerable. The organisation uses the support for its communication project which aims to explain why Finland finances UNFPA and what is being done with Finland's support as well as what results has been achieved. At the same time awareness will be raised among the general public MPs and MEPs as well as young people of the themes promoted by UNFPA namely the importance of gender equality young people's rights and sexual and reproductive health and rights in achieving sustainable development. Additionally the role of UNFPA in humanitarian crise s in implementing UNFPA's resolution 1325 'Women peace and security' and Resolution 2250 'Youth Peace and Security' will be communicated. The support granted for 2021-2022 is ? 37 12651.

The Family Federation of Finland is an expert organisation focusing on sexual and reproductive health and rights and the only representative of the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) in Finland. Finland is one of UNFPA's largest and longest-standing fi nancial supporters and The Family Federation of Finland promotes the same priorities as UNFPA through its own human rights-based work that focuses on promoting the sexual and reproductive health and rights of the most vulnerable. The organisation uses the support for its communication project which aims to explain why Finland finances UNFPA and what is being done with Finland's support as well as what results has been achieved. At the same time awareness will be raised among the general public MPs and MEPs as well as young people of the themes promoted by UNFPA namely the importance of gender equality young people's rights and sexual and reproductive health and rights in achieving sustainable development. Additionally the role of UNFPA in humanitarian crise s in implementing UNFPA's resolution 1325 'Women peace and security' and Resolution 2250 'Youth Peace and Security' will be communicated. The support granted for 2021-2022 is ? 37 12651.

tag.narrative: Improving democracy in societies is a secondary priority area in this activity
